intro: Succisa fussiana, commonly known as the yellow bell heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are leathery and aromatic, typical of many plants in its native habitat. Succisa fussiana is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils and can thrive in rocky or sandy environments.
